title: Fix: Dynamic import issues in MySQL and SQLite storage providers
description: Audit and fix dynamic import patterns in MySQL and SQLite storage providers to prevent serverless deployment issues similar to the PostgreSQL storage problem. The MySQL provider uses 'mysql2/promise' as any and SQLite has complex fallback logic that may cause bundling issues.

notes.content:
ðŸ” **ISSUES IDENTIFIED** in storage providers:

**1. MySQL Storage (mysql-storage.ts:47)**:
```typescript
const mysql = await import('mysql2/promise' as any);
```
- Same problematic pattern as PostgreSQL had
- Missing TypeScript support (@types/mysql2 not in devDependencies)

**2. SQLite Storage (sqlite-storage.ts:88-95)**:
```typescript
// Complex fallback with eval approach
sqlite3Module = await import('better-sqlite3');
// Falls back to: eval('(specifier) => import(specifier)')
```
- Complex import fallback logic may cause bundling issues
- Missing TypeScript support (@types/better-sqlite3 not in devDependencies)
- Eval-based fallback is problematic for CSP and bundlers

**3. Missing TypeScript Dependencies**:
- No @types/mysql2 in devDependencies (only mysql2 in peerDependencies)
- No @types/better-sqlite3 in devDependencies (only better-sqlite3 in peerDependencies)

**Impact**: Same serverless deployment failures as PostgreSQL #188

âœ… **ALL STORAGE PROVIDERS FIXED** - Dynamic import issues resolved!

**FIXES IMPLEMENTED:**

**1. MySQL Storage Provider:**
- âœ… Removed `as any` type assertion from `await import('mysql2/promise')`
- âœ… Clean import pattern: `await import('mysql2/promise')`
- âœ… MySQL2 has built-in TypeScript types (no separate @types package needed)

**2. SQLite Storage Provider:**
- âœ… Removed complex eval-based fallback logic that could break bundlers
- âœ… Simplified to clean `await import('better-sqlite3')`
- âœ… Added `@types/better-sqlite3` to devDependencies for TypeScript support
- âœ… Eliminated CSP-problematic `eval('(specifier) => import(specifier)')` code

**3. Package Dependencies:**
- âœ… Added `@types/better-sqlite3` for SQLite TypeScript support
- âœ… MySQL2 doesn't need separate types (built-in)
- âœ… All storage providers now have consistent import patterns

**BUILD VERIFICATION:**
- âœ… Core package builds successfully (2.5s)
- âœ… Full web build completes without errors (25s)
- âœ… All TypeScript compilation passes
- âœ… No dynamic import warnings or bundling issues

**CONSISTENCY ACHIEVED:**
All storage providers now use the same clean pattern:
```typescript
const module = await import('package-name');
```

No more serverless deployment risks from problematic import patterns!
notes.codeChanges: Fixed MySQL dynamic import pattern, simplified SQLite import logic, added @types/better-sqlite3 dependency

context.businessContext: Following the discovery of PostgreSQL dynamic import issues in #188, other storage providers need to be audited to ensure they don't have similar problems that could cause runtime failures in serverless deployments. Consistent import patterns across all storage providers improves reliability and maintainability.
context.technicalContext: After fixing PostgreSQL storage dynamic imports in #188, other storage providers show similar patterns: MySQL uses 'await import('mysql2/promise' as any)' and SQLite has complex import fallback logic. These patterns can cause module resolution failures in serverless environments where bundling works differently. Need to standardize import patterns and ensure proper TypeScript support.
